txt.en: 'I'll go where I please and do what I please, and anyone who stands in my way is going to pay for it!'
A secret Yonder-watch store-hole can be found in the woods between Gamwich and Long Cleeve.\n\nYou should talk to Fredegar Bolger at the store-hole.

'If the Yonder-watch hopes to outwit Lotho and his Bounders, they are going to need some supplies, and I have just the things!\n\n'I need you to bring these supplies to the Bounders in Long Cleeve. Whatever you do, don't get caught by Lotho's Bounders!'
Confront Bill Ferny
Yonder-watch supplies can be found at the secret store-hole in the woods between Gamwich and Long Cleeve.\n\nYou should carry Yonder-watch supplies to a Bounder in Long Cleeve.
Defeat Bill Ferny
The Yonder-watch will need supplies if they are to put a stop to Lotho's plans.
Talk to Bounder Tudge in Long Cleeve

'Hmm, I do not know this Bill Ferny. Do you think he might be in league with Lotho?\n\n'No, I doubt it. Lotho might be a sour-faced fellow, but he's still a hobbit, and I can't imagine he'd have anything to do with this Ferny fellow.'
The Long Cleeve Run
Talk to Fredegar Bolger at the secret store-hole
A Bounder of the Yonder-watch can be found in Long Cleeve.\n\nYou should talk to Bounder Tudge in Long Cleeve.

'Thank you for these supplies. Fredegar has been of tremendous help to our cause.\n\n'While I have you here, would you mind assisting me with something? There is a Man named Bill Ferny lurking about near here, and I suspect he is up to no good. His presence will begin to frighten the children before long. So shoo him away... with force!'
You were spotted by one of Lotho's Bounders!
Confronted Bill Ferny
'I'll show you!'
You have failed to deliver the supplies
Carry Yonder-watch supplies to a Bounder in Long Cleeve
You taught him a lesson... but will it stick?
Bill Ferny can be found near Long Cleeve in the Yondershire.\n\nYou should confront Bill Ferny.
Collect the Yonder-watch supplies from the secret store-hole
<rgb=#FF0000>Avoid Lotho's Bounders</rgb>
'This is just what we needed!'
Confront Bill Ferny
'I give up! I give up!'
